definitions: building for housing motor vehicles or storing items
establishment where vehicles are repaired or serviced commercially
examples: Park the car in the garage before the storm arrives tonight
The garage was cluttered with old boxes and forgotten tools
The garage fixed my brakes and changed the oil yesterday
She took her car to the garage for its annual inspection

definitions: distinctive taste of food or drink experienced in the mouth
distinctive quality or atmosphere of something
examples: The soup needs more flavor so add salt and herbs
Ice cream comes in dozens of flavors from vanilla to exotic
The restaurant captures the authentic flavor of Italian cuisine perfectly
Each neighborhood has its own unique flavor and personality

definitions: enclosed compartment for cooking and heating food using gas or electricity
industrial chamber used for heating drying or burning materials
examples: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees before baking the cake
The turkey cooked in the oven for three hours yesterday
The pottery kiln oven reaches temperatures over two thousand degrees
Industrial ovens cure paint on automobile parts during manufacturing

definitions: feeling of pleasure or contentment when needs or desires are met
fulfillment of one's wishes expectations or needs
examples: Customer satisfaction is our company's top priority every single day
She felt deep satisfaction after completing the difficult project
The job offers little satisfaction despite the high salary
Nothing beats the satisfaction of growing your own vegetables

definitions: unjust treatment of different categories of people based on prejudice
recognition and understanding of the difference between things
examples: Workplace discrimination based on age is illegal in most countries
The civil rights movement fought against racial discrimination for decades
Wine tasters need fine discrimination between subtle flavors and aromas
Color discrimination helps artists mix paints to exact shades

definitions: period of temporary economic decline with reduced trade and industrial activity
action of receding or state of being receded
examples: The recession caused unemployment to rise and businesses to close
Economic indicators suggest another recession may be approaching soon
The recession of the tide revealed hidden treasures on beach
Gum recession can expose tooth roots causing sensitivity problems

definitions: claim or assertion that someone has done something illegal or wrong
formal charge or claim requiring proof in legal proceedings
examples: The allegation of fraud led to a full investigation immediately
She denied all allegations made against her in the lawsuit
Serious allegations require substantial evidence to support them legally
The newspaper printed allegations without verifying their accuracy first

definitions: deep resonant sound like that made by heavy objects or explosions
period of rapid economic growth prosperity or expansion
examples: The boom of thunder shook the windows during the storm
We heard a loud boom when the tree fell down
The tech boom created many millionaires in Silicon Valley
The housing boom ended when interest rates increased sharply

definitions: limitation or control placed on something by rules or laws
state of being limited or restricted in movement or access
examples: Dietary restrictions prevented her from eating gluten or dairy products
The new restrictions limit gatherings to fifty people maximum
Travel restrictions made international trips difficult during the pandemic
Age restrictions apply to purchasing alcohol and tobacco products

definitions: precious stone consisting of clear colorless crystallized carbon
four-sided figure or the baseball playing field shape
examples: The engagement ring featured a two-carat diamond in platinum setting
Diamonds form deep underground under extreme pressure and heat
The baseball diamond needs new grass planted before season starts
Players warmed up on the diamond before the game began

definitions: firmly held belief or opinion about something
formal declaration that someone is guilty of a criminal offense
examples: Her conviction that education changes lives motivated her teaching career
He spoke with conviction about the need for environmental protection
The conviction was overturned after new evidence emerged years later
His criminal conviction prevented him from certain job opportunities

definitions: back part of the human foot below the ankle
part of a shoe or boot supporting the heel
examples: The blister on her heel made walking painful all day
Runners often develop problems with their heel and achilles tendon
These shoes have four-inch heels that are difficult to walk in
The cobbler replaced the worn heel on my favorite boots

definitions: state of being known or recognized by many people
public prominence or celebrity status
examples: The actor achieved fame after starring in the blockbuster movie
Fame came suddenly when her song went viral online
Some people seek fame while others have it thrust upon them
The price of fame includes loss of privacy and constant scrutiny

definitions: seat suspended by ropes or chains for swinging back and forth
rhythmic movement back and forth or from side to side
examples: Children played on the swing set during recess every day
The porch swing creaked gently in the evening breeze
The pendulum's swing measured exactly one second each way
Golf requires a smooth controlled swing for accuracy

definitions: series of games to determine a championship winner
additional game or round to decide the outcome of a tie
examples: The team made the playoffs for the first time in years
Playoff tickets cost much more than regular season games
The tournament went to a playoff after players tied
Sudden death playoff rules create exciting finishes in golf

definitions: woman who performs in plays films or television professionally
female artist who portrays characters in dramatic productions
examples: The actress won an Oscar for her powerful dramatic performance
She dreamed of becoming an actress since childhood drama classes
Famous actresses often struggle with typecasting in similar roles
The actress prepared for months to portray the historical figure

definitions: way in which something is arranged presented or organized
structure of data for processing storage or display
examples: The new format makes the magazine easier to read
Please follow the required format for your research paper
Save the document in PDF format for easy sharing
The file format isn't compatible with older software versions

definitions: prolonged public disagreement or heated discussion about something
dispute or argument that involves many people with strong opinions
examples: The controversy over the new policy divided the community deeply
Environmental controversies often pit economic interests against conservation needs
The book sparked controversy with its radical political views
They tried to avoid controversy by remaining neutral publicly

definitions: automobile or car used for transportation
automatic or self-operating mechanism or function
examples: The auto industry employs millions of workers worldwide today
She bought a used auto from the local dealership
Set the camera to auto mode for easy picture taking
The auto save feature prevents losing important work

definitions: sum of money given by organization for a particular purpose
formal consent or permission to do something
examples: The research grant funded her cancer studies for three years
Students applied for grants to help pay college tuition
The judge will grant permission for the records release
The king would grant titles to his loyal supporters

definitions: store selling food and household supplies
items of food sold in such a store
examples: She shops at the grocery store every Saturday morning
The new grocery offers organic produce and local products
Put the grocery bags on the kitchen counter please
Weekly grocery shopping helps families budget their food expenses

definitions: main office or center of operations for an organization
place from which military or other operations are directed
examples: Corporate headquarters moved to a new downtown location last year
The company's headquarters employs over five thousand people globally
Military headquarters coordinated the rescue operation from secure bunkers
Police headquarters received dozens of calls about the incident

definitions: comparative darkness caused by shelter from direct light
variety of a color differing slightly from others
examples: We sat in the shade of the oak tree to escape the heat
The shade from the building kept the garden too cool
This paint comes in twelve shades of blue to choose from
She selected a lighter shade of lipstick for daytime wear

definitions: device that measures and records quantity degree or rate
basic rhythmic structure of verse in poetry
examples: The electric meter shows how much power we've used this month
Parking meters require quarters for each hour of parking
Shakespeare often wrote in iambic pentameter with five-beat lines
The poem's meter creates a musical quality when read aloud

definitions: tube used to convey water gas or other substances
device for smoking tobacco consisting of tube and bowl
examples: The plumber fixed the broken pipe under the kitchen sink
Water pipes froze during the extremely cold winter weather
His grandfather smoked a pipe filled with cherry tobacco
The antique pipe collection included pieces from many countries

definitions: special enjoyable event organized to mark an occasion
action of marking important day or event with festivities
examples: The wedding celebration lasted until dawn with dancing and music
Birthday celebrations often include cake candles and presents
The town's victory celebration brought thousands to the streets
New Year celebrations vary widely across different cultures worldwide

definitions: quantity that fills the hand when partially closed
small number or amount of people or things
examples: She grabbed a handful of popcorn from the bowl
The child picked up handfuls of sand at the beach
Only a handful of students attended the optional lecture
A handful of companies control most of the market share

definitions: exclusive legal right to reproduce publish or sell creative work
protection given to creators of original works
examples: The author holds copyright on all her published novels
Copyright law protects creators from unauthorized copying of work
Check copyright status before using images from the internet
The copyright expires seventy years after the creator's death

definitions: person's name written in distinctive way for identification
distinctive pattern or characteristic by which something is recognized
examples: Please put your signature on the bottom line of the contract
The bank compared signatures to verify the check's authenticity
The chef's signature dish features locally sourced ingredients uniquely prepared
That guitar sound is his signature style instantly recognizable

definitions: senior member of Christian clergy in charge of a diocese
chess piece that moves diagonally across the board
examples: The bishop led the Easter service at the cathedral
Bishops oversee multiple churches within their designated diocese area
She moved her bishop to attack the opponent's king
In chess each player starts with two bishops

definitions: liquid dish typically made by combining vegetables meat and stock
chaotic or difficult situation
examples: Chicken soup is a popular remedy for colds and flu
The restaurant serves soup as an appetizer before meals
The fog was as thick as pea soup this morning
We're in the soup now with this deadline approaching

definitions: company that transports goods or people professionally
person or animal that transmits disease without showing symptoms
examples: The mail carrier delivers packages six days a week
Choose a reliable carrier for shipping valuable items internationally
Mosquitoes are carriers of malaria in tropical regions worldwide
Some people are carriers of genetic conditions without knowing

definitions: date on which an event took place in a previous year
celebration of a significant date or milestone
examples: They celebrated their 25th wedding anniversary with a cruise
The company's anniversary sale offers huge discounts every July
The anniversary of the tragedy is marked with a memorial service
Tomorrow marks the anniversary of our first meeting

definitions: flat round bread topped with tomato sauce cheese and various toppings
popular food originating from Italy served in slices
examples: We ordered pizza with pepperoni and mushrooms for dinner
The pizza place delivers until midnight on weekends
Homemade pizza tastes better than frozen varieties from stores
Pizza night is a Friday tradition in our family

definitions: moral principles that govern behavior and decision making
rules of conduct for members of a profession
examples: The company's ethics policy prohibits accepting expensive gifts from vendors
Philosophy students debate ethics and moral dilemmas in class
Medical ethics require doctors to maintain patient confidentiality always
The journalist violated ethics by revealing her anonymous source

definitions: extremely famous person especially in a particular field
traditional story from the past that may not be true
examples: Michael Jordan is a basketball legend known worldwide
The singer became a legend in the country music industry
The legend of King Arthur includes knights and magic
Local legends tell of buried treasure in these hills

definitions: large bird of prey with hooked beak and keen sight
score of two strokes under par on a golf hole
examples: The bald eagle is the national bird of the United States
Eagles build huge nests high in trees or on cliffs
She scored an eagle on the par-five seventeenth hole
Getting an eagle requires exceptional skill and some luck

definitions: grant or payment made to support a student's education
academic study or achievement in a particular field
examples: The scholarship covered her tuition and books for four years
Athletic scholarships help talented players afford college education
His scholarship on ancient texts earned international recognition
The professor's scholarship includes dozens of published research papers

definitions: line on surface of something where it has split without breaking
sudden sharp sound like something breaking
examples: The crack in the wall grew larger after the earthquake
Seal the cracks around windows to prevent drafts
We heard the crack of thunder immediately after the lightning
The crack of the bat signaled a home run

definitions: state of belonging to a group club or organization
all the members of a group collectively
examples: Gym membership includes access to all classes and equipment
Her membership in the professional association helps her network
The club's membership voted to change the bylaws last night
Membership has grown by twenty percent this year alone

definitions: position of being upright on one's feet
position or reputation within a group or society
examples: After standing all day her feet were tired and sore
The audience gave a standing ovation after the performance
His standing in the community improved after his charitable work
Check your academic standing before registering for advanced courses

definitions: state of having owning or controlling something
item owned or controlled by someone
examples: Possession of stolen goods is a serious criminal offense
The team maintained possession of the ball for most of the game
Pack your possessions carefully before the move next week
Her most prized possession was her grandmother's wedding ring

definitions: formally concluded agreement between countries or states
contract in writing between two or more political authorities
examples: The peace treaty ended five years of bitter conflict
Both nations signed the treaty banning nuclear weapons testing
Trade treaties facilitate commerce between partner countries worldwide
The treaty negotiations lasted for months before reaching agreement

definitions: state of being awake and aware of surroundings
awareness or perception of something by a group
examples: The patient regained consciousness after the surgery slowly
Meditation can alter states of consciousness and perception
Environmental consciousness has increased dramatically in recent years
The book explores consciousness and the nature of reality

definitions: process of making goods in factories on a large scale
branch of industry that produces goods
examples: Manufacturing jobs have declined in many developed countries recently
The manufacturing process requires strict quality control measures
China leads the world in manufacturing output and exports
Advanced manufacturing uses robots and artificial intelligence systems

definitions: public or formal statement about a fact or intention
act of making something known publicly
examples: The company's announcement surprised investors and employees alike
Wedding announcements appeared in the local newspaper Sunday edition
The principal made an announcement over the school intercom system
We're waiting for the official announcement of the election results

definitions: cosmetic products applied to face to enhance appearance
combination of qualities or ingredients forming something
examples: She applied makeup carefully before the photo shoot began
The makeup artist transformed actors into believable characters
The ethnic makeup of the neighborhood has changed over time
Scientists study the genetic makeup of different organisms

definitions: sudden sharp explosive sound
modern commercial music typically with strong rhythm
examples: The balloon made a loud pop when it burst suddenly
We heard the pop of champagne corks at midnight
Pop music dominates radio stations and streaming services worldwide
The pop star's concert sold out in minutes online

definitions: statement about what will happen in the future
forecast based on knowledge experience or evidence
examples: Weather predictions help people plan outdoor activities safely
His prediction about the election outcome proved remarkably accurate
Scientists make predictions based on data and tested theories
The prediction model uses artificial intelligence to forecast trends

definitions: state of being stable and not likely to change
quality of being firmly established or unlikely to fail
examples: Political stability attracts foreign investment to developing countries
The medication helps maintain emotional stability for patients
Financial stability requires careful budgeting and regular savings
Testing ensures the stability of the bridge under heavy loads
